handNote.p: Ker's hand 1 of two. A hybrid vernacular minuscule: caroline a, caroline f (reaching below the line) mixed with insular f, long s; tironian note and ẏ. The scribe could be the one of Ker's no. 62 (CCCC 367, pt II, fols. 1-2 and 7-10). Various South-Eastern origins have been suggested. There is evidence for an Ely provenance.
